{{Spoiler}} {{quote|A Healer whose command of water can fell foes and heal allies in the same beat; a battlefield messiah.|Class menu description}} [[File:Lifesage Class Icon.png|thumb|180px|The Lifesage class icon]] '''Lifesage''' is an [[Agnus|Agnian]] [[Healer]] [[Class (XC3)|class]] in {{XC3}}. == Overview == Lifesage is the class of [[Nia]]. The [[Blade (XC3)|Blade]] of the Lifesage class is the Anima Sword, which is Nia's [[Weapons (XC2)|Catalyst Scimitar]] from {{XC2}}, along with watery versions of [[Pyra]] and [[Mythra]]'s [[Aegis|Aegis Swords]] floating by the user. It is unlocked by going to the [[Hall of the Serene]] in the [[Cloudkeep]] after completing the main story, or in [[New Game + (XC3)|New Game +]]. Completing the [[Hero Quest|Ascension Quest]] ''[[Grasping My Future]]'' will increase this class's [[Class Rank (XC3)|rank]] limit from 10 to 20. {{clr}} == Class Aptitude and Unlock Requirements == {|class="xc1 centered" style="width:100%; valign:center;" !Party Member |[[File:Icon chara battle n0ah.png|60px]]
'''[[Noah]]''' |[[File:Icon chara battle 1.png|60px]]
'''[[Mio]]''' |[[File:Icon chara battle 2.png|60px]]
'''[[Eunie]]''' |[[File:Icon chara battle 3.png|60px]]
'''[[Taion]]''' |[[File:Icon chara battle 4.png|60px]]
'''[[Lanz]]''' |[[File:Icon chara battle 5.png|60px]]
'''[[Sena]]''' |- !Aptitude |[[File:XC3 Aptitude D Icon.png|35px]]||[[File:XC3 Aptitude S Icon.png|35px]]||[[File:XC3 Aptitude B Icon.png|35px]]||[[File:XC3 Aptitude B Icon.png|35px]]||[[File:XC3 Aptitude A Icon.png|35px]]||[[File:XC3 Aptitude C Icon.png|35px]] |- !Class Unlock Points Required |7,440 |''Class Inheritor'' |5,315 |4,250 |3,190 |6,375 |} == Class Rank Requirements == {| class="xc1 centered" width="45%" ! Rank ! CP needed ! Nopon Coin Cost |- | 1 | colspan="2" | None |- | 2 | 360 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 3 |- | 3 | 360 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 3 |- | 4 | 445 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 3 |- | 5 | 445 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 3 |- | 6 | 535 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 4 |- | 7 | 535 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 4 |- | 8 | 580 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 4 |- | 9 | 580 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 4 |- | 10 | 625 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 5 |- | colspan="3" class="event" | Complete ''[[Grasping My Future]]'' |- | 11 | 510 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 5 |- | 12 | 510 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 5 |- | 13 | 680 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 5 |- | 14 | 680 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 6 |- | 15 | 845 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 6 |- | 16 | 845 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 6 |- | 17 | 1015 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 6 |- | 18 | 1015 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 6 |- | 19 | 1100 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 7 |- | 20 | 1270 | [[File:Nopon Coin Silver.png|link=Nopon Coin (Silver)|38px]] x 7 |} {{clr}} == Class Stats == The Lifesage class grants the following multipliers to a character's base stats (see their individual pages for their base stats), and sets their Physical and Ether Defense to the following values, depending on their current Rank. Intermediate values are linearly interpolated between the minimum and maximum values, rounding to the nearest percent. {| class="xc1 centered" width="100%" ! Rank !! HP !! Attack !! Healing Power !! Dexterity !! Agility !! Physical Defense !! Ether Defense |- | 1 || 60% || 70% || 120% || 110% || 100% || 5% || 20% |- | 10 || 62% || 72% || 125% || 115% || 105% || 10% || 22% |- | 20 || 65% || 75% || 130% || 120% || 110% || 15% || 25% |} === Weapon Stats === The character's Attack stat after being modified by the above class stats is further modified by adding the class's weapon stat, which depends on the character's [[Level (XC3)|Level]], to obtain the final base Attack stat. These weapon stats also determine the character's Critical Rate and Block Rate. Characters temporarily assume these weapon stats to calculate relevant statistics when using a Master Art from this Class without it being part of a Fusion Art. If a Master Art is used in a Fusion Art, the character's current Class will be used instead for calculations. {| class="xc1 centered" width="60%" ! Level !! Attack !! Critical Rate !! Block Rate |- | 1 || 18 || 10% || 20% |- | 10 || 39 || 11% || 21% |- | 20 || 72 || 12% || 22% |- | 30 || 111 || 13% || 23% |- | 40 || 155 || 14% || 24% |- | 50 || 207 || 15% || 25% |- | 60 || 263 || 16% || 26% |- | 70 || 326 || 17% || 27% |- | 80 || 398 || 18% || 28% |- | 90 || 479 || 19% || 29% |- | 99 || 559 || 20% || 30% |} == Arts == * '''[[Divine Sword (XC3)|Divine Sword]]''' ([[Battle Arts (XC3)|Talent Art]]), Ignores enemy defense. Also heals all allies to a maximum of 150% of Healing Power. * '''[[Saber Slash (XC3)|Saber Slash]]''', Heals nearby allies when Art hits, to max of 100% of Healing Power. * '''[[Redemption (XC3)|Redemption]]''', Heals allies around the user. * '''[[Waterlily]]''', Places a [[Regenerate (XC3)|Regeneration]] field on the ground. * '''[[Hydro Blast (XC3)|Hydro Blast]]''', 30-50% chance to ignore defense and inflicts Blowdown. (Rank 1 Master Art) * '''[[Aqua Mind]]''', Continuously heals nearby allies' HP, boosts recharge speed by 25%. (Rank 10 Master Art) === Hero-exclusive Arts === * '''[[Last Hope]]''', 40-50% chance to ignore defense and inflicts Blowdown. * '''[[Merciful Heart]]''', An Ether attack that causes Knockback to enemies in front of Nia. * '''[[Redeeming Bloom]]''', Places a Regeneration field on the ground. == Skills == * [[File:XC3 Skill Icon 1.png]] '''Steadfast Feelings''', Restores nearby allies' HP on Art execution. Amount healed is equal to 30-50% of user's Healing. * [[File:XC3 Skill Icon 44.png]] '''Instant Regen+''', 25% chance to heal using 60-100% of Healing Power upon taking damage. * [[File:XC3 Skill Icon 45.png]] '''Enhanced Cellular Stimulus''', 30-50% chance on hit to deal 100%-200% of Healing Power as defense-bypassing damage. (Rank 5 Master Skill) * [[File:XC3 Skill Icon 38.png]] '''Abundant Oceans''', Reduces damage to allies by 10-15%, and boosts HP recovery by 10-15% (does not stack). (Rank 15 Master Skill) === Stat Increases=== {| class="xc1 centered" style="width:80%;" ! Class Rank ! Steadfast Feelings ! Instant Regen+ ! Enhanced Cellular Stimulus ! Abundant Oceans |- | 1 | 30% | 60% | 30%, 100% | 10%, 10% |- | 5 | 35% | 70% | 35%, 125% | 11%, 11% |- | 10 | 40% | 80% | 40%, 150% | 12%, 12% |- | 15 | 45% | 90% | 45%, 175% | 13.5%, 13.5% |- | 20 | 50% | 100% | 50%, 200% | 15%, 15% |} == Trivia == * The arts and skills of this class reference [[Battle Arts (XC2)|arts]], [[Blade Special]]s, and Blade Skills used by Nia as a [[Blade (XC2)|Blade]] with [[Rex]] in {{XC2|-}}. * Nia's Catalyst Scimitar features a [[Core Crystal]] near the weapon's handle when wielded by her. However, when used by any other character, the Core Crystal is replaced with the same [[Flame Clock]] featured on most other weapons. == Gallery == XC3 Nia Artwork.png|Nia as a Lifesage Divine Sword XC3.jpg|Mio using Divine Sword Lifesage Noah.png|Noah as a Lifesage Lifesage Mio.png|Mio as a Lifesage Lifesage Eunie.png|Eunie as a Lifesage Lifesage Taion.png|Taion as a Lifesage Lifesage Lanz.png|Lanz as a Lifesage Lifesage Sena.png|Sena as a Lifesage {{clr}} {{xc3 stub}} [[Category:XC3 Classes]]

During ''[[Gauntlet: Pro]]'' |respawn = No |hp = |strength = |healing = |dexterity = |agility = |physdef = 15% |ethdef = 0% |critrate = 12% |guardrate-front = 5% |guardrate-side = 0% |guardrate-back = 0% |tab2 = Pro Stage 10 |area2 = [[Land of Challenge (XC3)|Land of Challenge]] |category2 = [[Challenge Battle Enemy (XC3)|Challenge Battle Boss]] |level2 = 70 |detection2 = |spawntime2 = During ''[[Gauntlet: Pro]]'' |respawn2 = No |hp2 = 870,128 |strength2 = 902 |healing2 = 299 |dexterity2 = 291 |agility2 = 260 |physdef2 = 15% |ethdef2 = 0% |critrate2 = 12% |guardrate-front2 = 5% |guardrate-side2 = 0% |guardrate-back2 = 0% |tab3 = Pro Stage 80 |area3 = [[Land of Challenge (XC3)|Land of Challenge]] |category3 = [[Challenge Battle Enemy (XC3)|Challenge Battle Boss]] |level3 = 105 |detection3 = |spawntime3 = During ''[[Gauntlet: Pro]]'' |respawn3 = No |hp3 = 21,581,411 |strength3 = 8,505 |healing3 = 16,362 |dexterity3 = 578 |agility3 = 505 |physdef3 = 15% |ethdef3 = 0% |critrate3 = 12% |guardrate-front3 = 5% |guardrate-side3 = 0% |guardrate-back3 = 0% }} '''Lodmoro Plambuses''' are [[Challenge Battle Enemy (XC3)|Challenge Battle enemies]] that can spawn as regular enemies in the [[Archsage's Gauntlet]]. They can appear in the following stages, at the following levels (subject to level adjustment events): *Stages 44-46 of ''[[Gauntlet: Intermediate]]'', at level 67 *Stages 47-49 of ''[[Gauntlet: Pro]]'', at level 88 *Stages 51-53 of ''Gauntlet: Pro'', at level 91 *Stages 77-79 of ''Gauntlet: Pro'', at level 103 *Stages 81-83 of ''Gauntlet: Pro'', at level 106 *Stages 101-103 of ''Gauntlet: Pro'', at level 116 *Stages 121-123 of ''Gauntlet: Pro'', at level 132 Additionally, two Lodmoro Plambuses appear as boss enemies in ''Gauntlet: Pro'': one is fought at level 70 at Stage 10, while the other is fought at level 105 alongside a [[Segaro Garaffa]] and a [[Cuyask Garaffa]] at Stage 80. === Minor Enemy Stats === Lv 67=

{{spoiler}} [[File:XC3 Lone Exile Weapon Icon.png|thumb|Lone Exile Class Icon]] {{quote|An aggressive Defender whose swift, deadly slash strikes draw foes in, only to mow them down.|Class menu description}} '''Lone Exile''' (Japanese: {{Lang|ja|ローン エグザイル}}, ''Rōn eguzairu'') is a [[Keves]]i [[Defender (XC3)|Defender]] [[Class (XC3)|class]] in {{XC3}}.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hoHvpS2x8us == Overview == Lone Exiles are aggressive Defenders whose swift, deadly slash strikes draw foes in only to mow them down, and function similarly to [[Dunban]] in that they generate aggro primarily by inflicting large amounts of burst damage. While they gain further attack boosts at low health, they lack any inherent means of enhancing their survivability, which can be an issue in prolonged battles. It is the class of [[Ashera]]. It is unlocked by completing the [[Hero Quest]] ''[[The Wrath of Ashera]]''. The [[Class Rank (XC3)|Class Rank]] maximum is increased to 20 after completing the Ascension Quest ''[[A Deep-Seated Scar]]''. {{clr}} ==Class Aptitude and Unlock Requirements== {|class="xc1 centered" style="width:100%; valign:center;" !Party Member |[[File:Icon chara battle n0ah.png|60px]]

Intermediate values are linearly interpolated between the minimum and maximum values, rounding to the nearest percent. {| class="xc1 centered" width="100%" ! Rank !! HP !! Attack !! Healing Power !! Dexterity !! Agility !! Physical Defense !! Ether Defense |- | 1 || 100% || 85% || 10% || 100% || 115% || 30% || 40% |- | 10 || 105% || 90% || 12% || 105% || 120% || 32% || 45% |- | 20 || 110% || 95% || 15% || 110% || 125% || 35% || 50% |} === Weapon Stats === The character's Attack stat after being modified by the above class stats is further modified by adding the class's weapon stat, which depends on the character's [[Level (XC3)|Level]], to obtain the final base Attack stat. These weapon stats also determine the character's Critical Rate and Block Rate. Characters temporarily assume these weapon stats to calculate relevant statistics when using a Master Art from this Class without it being part of a Fusion Art. If a Master Art is used in a Fusion Art, the weapon stats corresponding to the character's current Class will be used instead for calculations. {| class="xc1 centered" width="60%" ! Level !!
